showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:48}); // Would you go check on it immediately?

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:32}); // I see, very well then.
Maybe, we'll fight together
again sometime.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:33}); // Sorry.
We only have {MEM1} gil.
We have to beg for your help.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:14}); // You can win by wiping out the enemy or
killing the enemy commander.{PAUSE}If the enemy reaches the shed,
they'll attack,
and you'll have no choice
but to battle immediately.{PAUSE}If you lose, the Condor's life
and oursare over.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:15}); // You can win by wiping out the enemy or
killing the enemy commander.{PAUSE}If the enemy reaches the shed,
they'll attack,
and you'll have no choice
but to battle immediately.{PAUSE}If you lose during direct
contact, and even if the enemy
gets to the reactor,
there's still a chance to win.{PAUSE}But, it's only a slight chance,
and we have no idea how much
the reactor can endure in an attack.{PAUSE}When we can't defend against
the attack any longer,
the Shinra will take our
lives, the Condor and
all the Materia in the reactor.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:63}); // Wyverns are flying types
that can move at high speed.
Stoner and Tristoner
aren't effective against them.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:64}); // Beasts are monster types
that do not move quickly,
but have explosive attacking power.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:65}); // Barbarians are human types.
They attack from a distance,
so you've got to be on your toes.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:66}); // Commanders are the enemy commanders.
They're the ones we want to subdue,
but they're formidable foes.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:67}); // Your mobile allies are:
Fighters, Attackers, Defenders,
Shooters, Repairers and Workers.{PAUSE}Your immobile allies are:
Stoner, Tristoner, Catapult,
and Fire Catapult.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:71}); // Fighters are good at defending
and attacking,
but aren't especially effective
or deficient for any enemy.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:72}); // Attackers move extremely fast
and are best for expanding
the front line.{PAUSE}They work good against enemy Beasts,
but not enemy Barbarians.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:73}); // Defenders have high endurance,
but move slowly.
They're best suited for defense.{PAUSE}Defenders work best against enemy
Barbarians, but not enemy Wyverns.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:74}); // Shooters attack from a distance,
but have low endurance.
Shooters work best against
enemy Wyverns, but not enemy Beasts.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:75}); // Repairers repair allied units,
but have little attacking power.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:76}); // Workers set mines.
Mines have strong
attacking power,
but Workers don't.{PAUSE}Mines explode when touched
by the enemy.
The explosions will damage
everything in the immediate area.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:77}); // Stoners can fire a single boulder,
causing extensive damage to
every enemy it hits.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:78}); // Tristoners can fire three boulders
simultaneously,
causing extensive damage to
every enemy they hit.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:16}); // We can't use the Tristoner or
Fire Catapult, because they
are still not ready.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:17}); // The Fire Catapult is ready now,
so we can set it up.{PAUSE}We can't use the Tristoner,
because it is still not ready.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:79}); // Catapults shoot rocks a great distance,
causing extensive damage to
every enemy they hit.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:80}); // Fire Catapults fire bombs
a great distance,
causing extensive damage to
every enemy they hit.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:16}); // We can't use the Tristoner or
Fire Catapult, because they
are still not ready.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:17}); // The Fire Catapult is ready now,
so we can set it up.{PAUSE}We can't use the Tristoner,
because it is still not ready.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:18}); // First off,
we must prepare the troops.{PAUSE}Move the cursor wherever the x mark
does not appear,
then press {PURPLE}[OK]{WHITE} to set-up.{PAUSE}After all positions are in place,
press {PURPLE}[CANCEL]{WHITE}.
This starts the battle.{PAUSE}Soldiers can only be arranged
near the shed, in the beginning.{PAUSE}That's because if the soldiers are
too far away, they won't be able to
follow instructions.{PAUSE}You can only put soldiers above the
horizontal line at the very bottom.{PAUSE}Soldiers can be instructed
by pushing {PURPLE}[ASSIST]{WHITE}.
So if any commands are unclear,
push it.{PAUSE}Soldiers can report by
pushing {PURPLE}[OK]{WHITE}{PAUSE}The cursor will move to
the soldier who made the report.{PAUSE}Press {PURPLE}[CANCEL]{WHITE} and
you'll hear the report without moving.{PAUSE}And you can bet Shinra will send
platoons at you on a regular basis.{PAUSE}It would be great if you could
spare the time to help us{PAUSE}But, if you really don't have time,
would you contribute
some financial assistance?
showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:34}); // We have <fe>{MEM1} gil right now.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:39}); // That's enough money for now.
If we run out, we'll ask you for more.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:35}); // We need 3000 gil
for each battle.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:37}); // We are very grateful,
but you don't have enough money.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:38}); // Thanks.
This makes
{MEM1} gil.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:38}); // Thanks.
This makes
{MEM1} gil.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:39}); // That's enough money for now.
If we run out, we'll ask you for more.

ops.js:
showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:26}); // Hey we're a little short on money
so could you at least
make it {MEM1} gil?

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:82}); // You have 10 enemies.
There appear to be many Beasts,
so you may want to deploy
more Attackers.
runMinigame({mapId:356, x:9, y:114, z:17, value:128, gameType:3});

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:12}); // So, shall I let you in on our strategy?{PAUSE}The enemy has targeted
our mountain reactor and
will be climbing to reach it.{PAUSE}We must set a trap and
hire soldiers to protect the place.{PAUSE}Well, this is all we have
this village doesn't have any money.
Even if we wanted to fight,
we can't because we're broke.{PAUSE}We need 400 gil to hire one soldier.
So, if we hire 20 soldiers,
we need 8000 gil.{PAUSE}We need to ask you to use
your own money to hire these soldiers,
buy the equipment, set it
up and give the commands.{PAUSE}If you don't have time
could you help us
with a donation?{PAUSE}If you donate the money,
we can hire the soldiers
and block Shinra's attack.{PAUSE}We know what we're asking is selfish.
We sent our wives and children
to another village,
But, we're resigned to stay.{PAUSE}Let's get back to basics.
If the enemy reaches this shed,
you'll have to fight them off
immediately.{PAUSE} It's not the end of the world,
but if you lose repeatedly,
it could be dangerous.

dialogStrings: Watch Room
Do you guys want to see it, too?

{Cloud}
See what?

{Tifa}
What?

{Cid}
What is it?

The condor.
It's huge.
Come on, have a look.

What do ya think?
Awesome, huh?

So, will you help us?
I don't want them to get killed.

They're gigantic birds and so striking.
We simply can't let them be killed
by man's selfishness.{PAUSE}Of course not.
There's no way,
especially by the Shinra.

If you want to see them,
get on that chair over there.
Thanks for accepting.

So shall I let you in on our strategy?{PAUSE}The enemy has targeted
our mountain reactor and
will be climbing to reach it.{PAUSE}We must set a trap and
hire soldiers to protect the place.{PAUSE}Well, this is all we have
This village doesn't have any money.
Even if we wanted to fight,
we can't because we're broke.{PAUSE}We need 400 gil to hire one soldier.
So, if we hire 20 soldiers,
we need 8000 gil.{PAUSE}We need to ask you to use
your own money to hire these soldiers,
buy the equipment, set it
up and give the commands.{PAUSE}We know what we're asking is selfish.
We sent our wives and children
to another village,
But, we're resigned to stay.{PAUSE}Let's get back to basics.
If the enemy reaches this shed,
you'll have to fight them off
immediately.{PAUSE}It's a one shot gamble but
we're asking for your help.

Now then, is there anything you wish to ask?

First off,

So if any commands are unclear,

Wyverns are flying types
that can move at high speed.
Stoner and Tristoner
aren't effective against them.

Beasts are monster types
that do not move quickly,
but have explosive attacking power.

Barbarians are human types.
They attack from a distance,
so you've got to be on your toes.

Commanders are the enemy commanders.
They're the ones we want to subdue,
but they're formidable foes.

Your mobile allies are:
Fighters, Attackers, Defenders,

Fighters are good at defending
and attacking,
but aren't especially effective
or deficient for any enemy.

Attackers move extremely fast
and are best for expanding
the front line.{PAUSE}They work good against enemy Beasts,
but not enemy Barbarians.

Defenders have high endurance,
but move slowly.
They're best suited for defense.{PAUSE}Defenders work best against enemy
Barbarians, but not enemy Wyverns.

Shooters attack from a distance,
but have low endurance.
Shooters work best against
enemy Wyverns, but not enemy Beasts.

Repairers repair allied units,
but have little attacking power.

Workers set mines.
Mines have strong
attacking power,
but Workers don't.{PAUSE}Mines explode when touched
by the enemy.
The explosions will damage
everything in the immediate area.

Stoners can fire a single boulder,
causing extensive damage to
every enemy it hits.

Tristoners can fire three boulders
simultaneously,
causing extensive damage to
every enemy they hit.

Catapults shoot rocks a great distance,
causing extensive damage to
every enemy they hit.

Fire Catapults fire bombs
a great distance,
causing extensive damage to
every enemy they hit.

You must pay for every weapon you set up.
Even if you decide to move it later,
you can only get back
half of the gil you spent.
